page.title: 07LIFE-STYLES contd.
page.content: course,no machinery,and work therefore was done by hand and horse.There was hardly any trading,as everyone needed their own crops etc. to survive.People only traded their cattle etc. in Kidderminster market,six and half miles from Rushock. During the war,there was an R.A.F. dump near Hartlebury,where many jobs were created for the local people.Public transport had to be provided to carry people to the base. Bombs were dropped on the nearby common,as german planes,after seeing the local lake,knew they were near to the R.A.F. base.Many prisoners of war, from both Germany and Italy,were sent to work on the farms in the district. There were no clashes,and they were accepted generally. The nearest doctors
